dev.galactic.star.database.databases.mysql

Class MySqlDb

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.galactic.star.database.databases.mysql.MySqlDb

  • public class MySqlDb
extends java.lang.Object
    The database API used to interact with a MySQL database.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MySqlDb

        public MySqlDb(java.lang.String host,
               int port,
               java.lang.String databaseName,
               java.lang.String username,
               java.lang.String password,
               java.lang.String parameters)
        A constructor for the MySQL database that includes any extra queries you want to use.
        Parameters:
        host - Host of the server.
        port - Port of the database that is running on.
        databaseName - Name of the database in the database you want to interact with. Can be null or blank if you don't want to interact just yet.
        username - Username of the login details.
        password - Password of the login details.
        parameters - Any other attributes and values you want to use in the connection. Checkout MySQL Dev website for more info on the different parameters.

      • MySqlDb

        public MySqlDb(java.lang.String host,
               int port,
               java.lang.String databaseName,
               java.lang.String username,
               java.lang.String password)
        The base constructor for the MySQL database that includes.
        Parameters:
        host - Host of the server.
        port - Port of MySQL that is running on.
        databaseName - Name of the database in the MySQL database you want to interact with. Can be null or blank if you don't want to interact just yet.
        username - Username of the login details.
        password - Password of the login details.

      • deleteUser

        public MySqlDb deleteUser(java.lang.String host,
                          java.lang.String... accountNames)
        Deletes the user.
        Parameters:
        accountNames - A String varargs
        host - The host name that the user is tied to. galactic-star.dev would be the host name. So it would end up like john@galactic-star.dev
        Returns:
        Current instance of MySqlDb.
        See Also:

      • changeUserPassword

        public MySqlDb changeUserPassword(java.lang.String username,
                                  java.lang.String newPassword)
        Changes a specific user's password. You don't need to specify a host because it defaults to % which kinda means it is universal
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user who you want to change the password.
        newPassword - the new password.
        Returns:
        Current instance of MySqlDb.
        See Also:
        MySqlDb

      • changeUserPassword

        public MySqlDb changeUserPassword(java.lang.String host,
                                  java.lang.String username,
                                  java.lang.String newPassword)
        Changes a specific user's password.
        Parameters:
        host - The hostname that appears after the @ in a query. Such as root@galactic-star.dev
        username - The username of the user who you want to change the password.
        newPassword - the new password.
        Returns:
        Current instance of MySqlDb.
        See Also:
        MySqlDb
